movesets.name: Entry Hazard Layer

items.name: Berry Juice
items.description: Restores 20 HP when at 50% HP or less. One-time use.

movesets.description:
Moves

Stealth Rock breaks Focus Sash and Sturdy on almost all enemies and helps teammates KO the opposition. Spikes is ideally used after Stealth Rock is set up or if the opponent has no Ground-type immunities, and further assists the team with securing KOs. Rock Blast is the optimal choice as a STAB move for this set as it discourages setup sweepers, Substitute users, and opposing users of Sturdy or Focus Sash from setting up on Dwebble. Knock Off weakens foes by removing their items and delivers a powerful hit, particularly against Ghost- and Psychic-types.

Set Details

Berry Juice is the best item for Dwebble as it functions well with Sturdy. By combining Sturdy and Berry Juice, Dwebble is capable of surviving for two or three more turns than expected. 236 Speed EVs allow Dwebble to outspeed the majority of the tier and Speed tie with much of it as well, giving it ample opportunities to set up entry hazards. No EVs should be invested into HP to ensure that Berry Juice will fully heal Dwebble and so reset Sturdy.

Usage Tips

Oftentimes, the opponent will assume that Dwebble is carrying Sturdy and Berry Juice. They will subsequently switch out, giving Dwebble an extra turn to lay down entry hazards. This can mean more KOs for your team later on. Leading with Dwebble means that it can get up at least one layer of entry hazards, unless the opposing Pokemon is a Taunt user. Since Knock Off was buffed, Dwebble won't have to deal with as many Ghost-type switch-ins. However, avoid running Dwebble against Fighting-types, especially those using Knock Off and Drain Punch, as they can come out of these encounters victorious and with full health.

Team Options

Teammates that can prevent entry hazard removal are ideal, as they defeat this set's entire purpose; Ghost-types like Gastly block Rapid Spin and Prankster Taunt prevents Defog from being used. Defiant Pawniard makes a good teammate that can severely punish an opposing Defog user for trying to get rid of Dwebble's hazards, rewarding Pawniard with a hefty +2 Attack on the switch-in. Water-types like Chinchou cover Dwebble's only two weaknesses, Water- and Steel-type attacks, and are ideal partners for tanking some of the attacks that threaten it. Dwebble really appreciates something to switch into Mienfoo, particularly Taunt variants; Larvesta and Ponyta can threaten with a burn as it uses Fake Out, and Spritzee's ability nullifies Taunt.

movesets.name: SturdyJuice Smash

items.name: Berry Juice
items.description: Restores 20 HP when at 50% HP or less. One-time use.

movesets.description:
Moves

Shell Smash is the move that really makes Dwebble threatening, because it makes it both powerful and fast in one turn. X-Scissor is a Bug-type STAB that deals considerable damage. Stone Edge is a Rock-type STAB that is very strong, but a bit inaccurate. Rock Blast can be used instead to bypass Focus Sash and Sturdy, and it can potentially deal more damage than Stone Edge, but the number of hits is random, making it unreliable. Though Knock Off helps a bit with coverage, its ability to knock off foes' items is more important to Dwebble. Earthquake is an alternative that provides decent coverage with Dwebble's Rock-type STAB attack, and is notably good for nailing Chinchou. Earthquake is usually more important than Knock Off as it is a means of getting around Steel-types, and provides a neutral move against Fighting-types. Dwebble is usually a late-game sweeper and therefore should rely more on the fact that its counters are already weakened than on moves that weaken them further, but using Knock Off instead of Earthquake helps it function as an early-game wallbreaker.

Set Details

Berry Juice is the best item option for Dwebble, as Sturdy guarantees a turn of survival in the vast majority of cases and Berry Juice then restores Dwebble to full health even if it was hit with a move that would normally OHKO, resetting Sturdy in the process. A Speed stat of 15 guarantees it will outspeed most Choice Scarf users after a Shell Smash. Attack is maxed out to optimize Dwebble's sweeping ability after setting up with Shell Smash. No EVs should be placed into HP, as raising Dwebble's HP would keep Berry Juice from resetting Sturdy upon use.

Usage Tips

Dwebble can set up with Shell Smash against almost any attacker in the tier. The only Pokemon that it has problems with are Fighting-types with Knock Off, Steel-types, multi-hit moves, especially Rock Blast, Fake Out, which break Sturdy, and status moves, like burns or paralysis. Steel-types are easier to handle if Earthquake is included on the set, but Knock Off can be particularly helpful in breaking down walls.

Team Options

Spritzee and Trubbish make good partners because they help Dwebble beat Fighting-types, which resist both of Dwebble's STABs and can be very problematic. Trubbish can also set up Spikes, which Dwebble appreciates. Chinchou can help with tanking the Water- and Steel-type attacks aimed at Dwebble, and is particularly useful for keeping Magnemite at bay. Fire- or Fighting-type partners are good for threatening Steel-types as well, particularly Pawniard and Ferroseed. When not being used as a lead, Dwebble appreciates entry hazard removal from Defog or Rapid Spin, as entry hazards break its Sturdy and can ruin its SturdyJuice Shell Smash strategy.

moves.name: Aerial Ace
moves.description: Ignores accuracy modifiers.

moves.name: Attract
moves.description: Targets of the opposite gender are infatuated and have a 50% chance to do nothing.

moves.name: Block
moves.description: The target cannot switch out.

moves.name: Bug Bite
moves.description: Uses foe's Berry.

moves.name: Bulldoze
moves.description: Lowers target's Speed by 1 stage.

moves.name: Confide
moves.description: Lowers the target's Special Attack by 1 stage.

moves.name: Counter
moves.description: If hit by a physical attack, returns double the damage.

moves.name: Curse
moves.description: Does 1/4 of max HP damage per turn at the cost of half the user's max HP if the user is a Ghost. Boosts Attack and Defense and lowers Speed by 1 stage otherwise.

moves.name: Cut
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Dig
moves.description: User is made invulnerable for one turn, then hits the next turn.

moves.name: Double Team
moves.description: Boosts evasion by 1 stage.

moves.name: Earthquake
moves.description: Hits Pokemon using Dig with double Base Power.

moves.name: Endure
moves.description: The user always survives with at least 1 HP.

moves.name: Facade
moves.description: Has 140 Base Power when burned, paralyzed, or poisoned.

moves.name: Feint Attack
moves.description: Ignores accuracy modifiers.

moves.name: Flail
moves.description: Does more damage as HP decreases.

moves.name: Frustration
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Fury Cutter
moves.description: Power doubles with each consecutive hit.

moves.name: Hone Claws
moves.description: Boosts Attack and accuracy one stage.

moves.name: Iron Defense
moves.description: Boosts Defense by 2 stages.

moves.name: Knock Off
moves.description: Power is boosted 1.5x if user is holding a removable item. Removes the target's item.

moves.name: Nature Power
moves.description: Attack changes based on terrain.

moves.name: Night Slash
moves.description: Has a high critical hit rate.

moves.name: Poison Jab
moves.description: 30% chance to poison.

moves.name: Protect
moves.description: Prevents anything from working on the user that turn.

moves.name: Rest
moves.description: The user goes to sleep for two turns and restores all HP.

moves.name: Return
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Rock Blast
moves.description: Hits 2-5 times in one turn.

moves.name: Rock Polish
moves.description: Boosts Speed by 2 stages.

moves.name: Rock Slide
moves.description: 30% chance to flinch.

moves.name: Rock Smash
moves.description: 50% chance to lower Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: Rock Tomb
moves.description: Lowers Speed by 1 stage.

moves.name: Rock Wrecker
moves.description: User cannot move next turn.

moves.name: Rototiller
moves.description: Raises the Attack and Special Attack stats of Grass-type Pokemon.

moves.name: Round
moves.description: Power doubles if a teammate uses Round in the same turn.

moves.name: Sand Attack
moves.description: Lowers foe's accuracy by 1 stage.

moves.name: Sand Tomb
moves.description: Traps and damages target for 4-5 turns.

moves.name: Sandstorm
moves.description: Summons a sandstorm for 5 turns.

moves.name: Shadow Claw
moves.description: Has a high critical hit rate.

moves.name: Shell Smash
moves.description: Boosts user's Attack, Special Attack, and Speed by 2 stages and lowers user's Defense and Special Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: Slash
moves.description: Has a high critical hit rate.

moves.name: Sleep Talk
moves.description: Picks one of the user's moves at random. Can only be used while sleeping.

moves.name: Smack Down
moves.description: Can hit if target is using Fly, Bounce, or Sky Drop. Ends target's airborne moves and its benefits from Flying type or Levitate.

moves.name: Snore
moves.description: Can only be used while sleeping. 30% chance to flinch.

moves.name: Solar Beam
moves.description: Charges up turn 1; attacks on turn 2.

moves.name: Spikes
moves.description: Causes damage to the enemy whenever they switch.

moves.name: Stealth Rock
moves.description: Damages foe's switch-ins.

moves.name: Stone Edge
moves.description: Has a high critical hit rate.

moves.name: Strength
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Struggle Bug
moves.description: Lowers target's Special Attack by 1 stage.

moves.name: Substitute

moves.name: Swagger
moves.description: Confuses the target. Boosts its Attack by 2 stages.

moves.name: Swords Dance
moves.description: Boosts Attack by 2 stages.

moves.name: Toxic
moves.description: Inflicts intensifying poison on the target.

moves.name: Wide Guard
moves.description: Protects user and allies from multi-target attacks.

moves.name: Withdraw
moves.description: Boosts Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: X-Scissor
moves.description: No additional effect.

abilities.name: Sturdy
abilities.description: The weilder cannot be KO'd in one hit. OHKO moves will fail.

abilities.name: Weak Armor
abilities.description: Boosts Speed by 1 stage and lowers Defense by 1 stage when hit by a Physical move.
